intro: Sprengelia brachyota, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sprengelia brachyota is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
